reply_context.text:
The radius of an atom is fuzzy; we get to define where we say it ends.
Gas giants can hit 1.6 g/cm^3.
Asteroids vary from 0.5 to 2 g/cm^3.
Pluto has a density of 1.85 g/cm^3
The sun has a density of 1.4 g/cm^3
A 140 million solar mass black hole has the density of water af 0.3 au radius.

reply_context.text: This is bullshit. the GPGP isn't a problem we can solve by skimming the surface. The "patch" is a variety of sizes of particulates, mostly microscopic, that are present at many depths. Moreover, this has been a problem long enough that we're observing niche adaptation to the GPGP as a new biome.
